newsitem.title: FRANCE: ALPINE SKIING-MEN'S DOWNHILL PRACTICE CANCELLED.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-MEN'S DOWNHILL PRACTICE CANCELLED.

text.p: Bad weather forced the cancellation of Friday's final practice session for Saturday's men's World Cup downhill race.
Organisers said poor visibility on the upper part of the piste in the French Alpine resort of Chamonix made it impossible to stage the session.
They said the weather should clear up on Saturday and the race should go ahead as planned.
A slalom on Sunday as well as the men's season's first combined event will complete the weekend programme in this ski resort overlooked by Mont Blanc.
Defending World Cup downhill champion Luc Alphand was fastest in the first training run at Chamonix on Wednesday with his French team mate Adrien Duvillard setting the best time on Thursday.
